item.title: Report E-2024110343
item.description:
Report E-2024110343

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: CORDELE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On NOvember 6, 2024, one (1) tote of paint leaked approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the outside of the tote. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the site. Crews observed paint residue that had hardened on the top of the tote. AOTC crews scraped the paint from the tote utilizing hand tools. AOTC wiped down the area and containerized the paint residue and impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: There was 1 gallon of Non-Haz Primer and 2 Gallons of Haz Varnish / Stain that was released. There were 20 1qt cans of Varnish / Stain that were heavily damaged but did not release product. These were not fit for further, safe transport.

item.title: Report I-2024110057
item.description:
Report I-2024110057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: Buford
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Ferric Chloride to City of Buford Southside WWT. As the driver started to fill the tank he heard a tricking of liquid and investigated. He found ferric chloride coming from the tank. The tank has insulation around it so the crack was not easily visible. Driver immediately stopped the flow of product. 10 gallons of material leaked out of the crack into containment. The rest of the delivery was not made to the tank leaving 1080 lbs on the truck.

item.title: Report X-2024110581
item.description:
Report X-2024110581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-19T12:23:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/7/2024 at approximately 2100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5029982 at the ramp facility in Atlanta, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 2 fiberboard boxes, each containing 1 plastic jerrican. During sort operations, one of the packages was reportedly mishandled, resulting in spillage from the closure. The damaged package was placed in a salvage drum and the shipment awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024110266
item.description:
Report E-2024110266

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: SOCIAL CIRCLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2789 was damaged and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum, and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024110263
item.description:
Report E-2024110263

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 7, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of X-111 55GL was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 145-gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized soda ash, absorbents, and hand tools to remove the released product. A tote transfer was completed. All impacted materials were containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations, Inner contents: 4 plastic bottles ( MYCO LOW ODOR FLOOR STRIPPER) at 4 L each. 1 Loose Top caused the spill. All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for shipper disposition.
